name: Lost Colors
description:
From the collection "lost times"


Today I saw my first white hair!
he was sitting in the mirror
in a White
Cold
Indifferent suit 
he was staring at eyes of my youth
My mother was standing beside him 
Young, beautiful, shining!
She had a white hair strand sitting on her head
in a White, Cold, Indifferent suit  
And my grandmother was there
Young and beautiful, shining like a sun
With a white hair strand on her head!
   Suddenly 
white strands rise out of the frame
invaded me
wrapped around me
My body was lost in white hairs
my eyes disappeared beneath the lines 
  I was drowning 
Paddling
among white hairs and lines!
I had lost my eyes
Lost my strength 
Lost my beauty 
MY colors!
Darkness invaded 
The moon was dark
And stars
And he was there!
  sitting in a white, cold, indifferent suit!
Whispered in my ear:
How much you have become like your mother!
